tizo_trico wrote:
>
> St.Ack,
>
> I think that there is a problem with MirrorWriterProcessor (1.8) and
> windows. URLs that has spaces before and/or after a slash "/", are not
> written to the disk, because the directories cannot be created.
>








If you make a patch for MirrorWriter and test it on windows, I'll commit it.

Yours,
St.Ack
